title: Tunisia Dissolves Democratic Municipal Councils Under Authoritarian Consolidation
summary: President Kais Saied dissolves Tunisia's first democratic municipal councils created in 2018, completing a systematic dismantling of democratic institutions that began in July 2021. This action follows his earlier suspension of parliament, dismissal of the prime minister, and detention of opposition figures, marking the complete reversal of the Arab Spring's birthplace back to authoritarian rule.
